ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: I did not really use the textbook except to look up a few things. It's probably not worth buying because they have a copy in lab.
I think that the labs were really helpful to learning, and they are easy to look back on to use the skills for other projects, however, some of them might need to be reviewed for clarity.
RS is an emerging field that I believe will become more widely accessible in the future. I feel that this course does a superb job at providing students with the skills necessary to analyze RS data.
The field trips and labs were lumped into one group, but I did think I learned much more on the field trips than from the weekly labs.

The skills were very important for working in this field and the future of where it is headed. It was great to have structured lab time to guide us through learning the program over the course of the semester and have progressively less "hand-holding" in the labs over time.
The subject matter and the way it was taught and Larry.
The labs are really useful not just for the course but in the future to apply to other projects. The teachers were really knowledgable and helpful.
applying all the techniques learned during class to complete a project.
the possibility of working with the software and the images right after class
Seeing and thinking about what is possible and not possible with remote sensing technology.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: It would be great to get exposure to the other major remote sensing software package, even just to know what the interface looks like. I also wonder if it would be possible to have in some labs, like the georeferencing lab, some repetition of process. ie, be presented with a few different layers that need to be warped in different ways and have us practice 3 or 4 times with picking up on what the layer needs to be warped to and practice making the series of clicks a few times. I think that might help cement the software fluency a little better.
Availability of free satellite data, but I guess not really the professor's fault.
Maybe a little less of the math equation stuff in the first problem sets.
More TA hours near the end of the course to help students with their projects.
Nothing too serious, but sometimes lab questions were busy. Sometimes the theoretical side was frustrating because it took a lot to learn, only to realize that sometimes it was not usable.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: The Instructors and TAs were all of great help.
Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful. KT, Dea, Larry, and Ron - all great, all helpful, all ready to help at any time.
Help was amazing. Period.
The TA was very helpful and available. Dea Doklestic.
TAs were very helpful and responsive
They were always available, specially Larry.
Professors were very good at explaining complex concepts in a simple manner for us non-sciency folks!

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I am a Master of Forest Science, and this is an elective course but a topic and skill that I think is especially beneficial to take in looking to the future of the profession.

I'm interested in land management, and took this class to explore what is possible using remote sensing methods. It was perfect for that. Unlike some other students, I didn't really have a project in mind and just made one up.
I am in the public health school and I found the content really interesting and I could see how in the future even the information about other scientific disciplines will be relevant to me.
My focus in FES in social and environmental sciences. I feel the course applies to both topics.

Actually for my non-research-based focus, it was not a good match, but the knowledge itself I personally value, and it gave me a good update on physics, as well as learning techniques and software I would probably otherwise never learn. In this way it is even more valuable than just something that fits into my focus.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I wanted some experience with remote sensing.
An introduction to the topic and skill this course teaches is especially relevant to my professional area of interest.
I wanted to learn remote sensing because of my interest in the environmental factors and their effect on public health.
To learn how to analyze satellite data.
I had already taken Raster analysis and I thought that this course would complement it. Now I believe that I could easily use this course as the stepping stone for a career in remote sensing.
Advisor recommended, thought it fit into my focus, and personal interest.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes.
Yes.
Yes, I like the professor and his teaching style.Yes.
yes
Yes
Certainly.
Yes. Very valuable skillset.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
Yes. Knowledge of how remote sensing works (what it is), how it's done, and a touch of practicing it myself.
Yes.
yes
yes
Yes
No, it was different, and better.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: NA

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Find a project early in the semester and start working on it as soon as you can.
Keep up with the labs. It's not that hard to do - they're generally timed well, but go to lab section.
Uhm, some mathy science stuff in the beginning for the class (really awesome stuff), but you might not like that part if you are not into hard science.
Dont take other heavy classes at the same time.
The labs were a lot of work, but keep working on them, even if you get behind, to learn the skills. The feeling of learning each technique is awesome when you get it.
